turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, why are you making those faces?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I can't hear you.  I can't hear anything.  I'm, I'm, I'm, I'm gonna lose hearing in my ear!  I'm--

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Listen, you are witnessing genius!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I, I, my ears are experiencing a meltdown!  I can't hear anything.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Look, can't you feel the energy? It's tangible energy!  The room's alive with positive vibrations!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Don't, no, please.  Will you-- No, don't...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You want some?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Come on, Mickey.  Come on.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: But, no, you've been doing that all night!  You're gonna...you're gonna burn a hole in your... You're gonna develop a third nostril!  Really,  don't, please.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Can we, can we go?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: My--uh...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I love songs about extraterrestrial life, don't you?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Not when they're sung by extraterrestrials.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, well, I cannot communicate with you!  I, you know, I never realized you were such a tightass. MICKEY I can't understand you.  Your sisters, both sisters have such good taste in music.  I don't know where you went, went wrong.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Do you mind?  I'm-I'm my own person.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Can I take you someplace to hear something nice?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Eh, Mickey, it's getting late.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Now come on, you're be--, 'cause you're being angry at me.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Thanks for a swell time.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, if you didn't like it, you didn't like it, but you didn't have to talk while the guy was singing.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I was so bored!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah, that's tough!  You don't deserve Cole Porter.  You should stay with those groups that look like they're gonna stab their mother!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: At least I'm open to new concepts!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: And you don't have to snort cocaine at the table all the time!  What do you, what do you do?  Carry a kilo around in your purse?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: This crowd wouldn't know the difference!  They're embalmed!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Jesus...  I'm glad Hannah got us together. You know, she's got a great instinct for people.  Really.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, look, I'm sorry it didn't work out.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah.  Me, too.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You know, it's probably my fault. I've been a little depressed lately.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Right.  Yeah.  I had a...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: God!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...I had a great time tonight, really.  It was like the Nuremberg Trials.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Mmm, I don't know if you remember me, but we had the worst night of my life together.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I remember you.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yes, you do recall, right?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I recall you.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I was walking past and I saw you in here...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...and I thought I'd come in and...and we could replay, uh, the whole, uh...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: We didn't hit it off.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh, that's putting it mildly.  We did everything but exchange gunshots.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Good.  How are you?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You look wonderful.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, no.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah, really.  You do.  You do.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: It was a terrible evening.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, it was.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Remember slamming the cab door in my face and..  you know, it came very dangerously close to emasculating my nose in a...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I'd never do that.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...in a really horrible way.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, well, that was a long time ago.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You look wonderful.  You do.  What happened to you?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: People change...you know.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, I hope you've changed.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, I hope you have, too. MICKEY  I hope so for your sake, because, uh, your personality left something to be desired...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, and for yours.  I'm sure you've changed.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...namely a personality.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: So how are you?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I'm okay.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You didn't answer my question. What are you doing?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, nothing much.  You know...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: ...just some stuff.  A little of this, a little of that, that's all.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah?  Is that an embarrassing question?  Should I have not asked it?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Probably not.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Are you, are you out of work or something?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: No, well...I've been trying to write.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Have you?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, that's interesting.  Wh-what kind of stuff?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh...well, you-you're not interested in this.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: No, you can tell me.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: No, I am.  I am.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, no, millions of people come up to you and say, "Hey, I have something I just wrote," right?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Nobody ever said it.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: This is it.  Yeah.  This is really-- HOLLY  Well, wo-would you be willing to-to read it?  Something...that I wrote?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, yes, I would if, uh, if it would mean anything to you.  I don't know why it would.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: No, the reason I ask is--

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You've always hated my taste in the past.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: No, I haven't.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You have.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I haven't.  No, the reason why I ask is I think it might make a great, uh, television script, and, you know, you're so active in television, so--

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I'm not anymore.  I haven't, I haven't been in television for a year.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You're kidding me.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I've done no television whatsoever. No.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I may, I may have to get back into it, 'cause my accountant says that I'm running out of dollars. But...but, um, no, I haven't, I just sort of dropped out for a year...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh.  Oh.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...which is a long, dull story and I won't get into it.  But--

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You're okay, though, huh?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I'm-- Yes.  Yes, I'm fine.  I'm fine.  How are you?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, I'm fine.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What...what about your script?  So what's it about?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, I'd love it if you'd read it, actually, 'cause I really would value your opinion.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You have to remember, we-we-we didn't agree on one thing.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: But you have to remember while you're reading and you're cursing my name, you know, that this is my first script.  Well, it's not my first script.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Hmm.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Actually, my first script was about Hannah and her husband, but, uh...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: ...Hannah read it, she got really angry, and... you know, then I felt badly, so I--

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh, well, God, I can imagine what you wrote.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, no!  It wasn't anything bad. But she just... you know.  I don't know.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: So, uh...I threw it out, but I have this other one.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, you know, I-I-I...you know, if you want me to, I'll read it.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, gosh, I don't know.  Well, could I come over tomorrow and read it to you?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Come over tomorrow and read it to me?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You must be joking.  I've been doing all my own reading since I was forty...you know.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Hmm.  I think it's lucky I ran into you.  Maybe.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, what about me?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, well.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I should have kept going.  I-I have a sneaking feeling, a nagging sensation I should've kept walking and...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: No, you can tell me straight.  It's okay.  Just, you know, tell me what you think.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: It's great.  I swea-- I'm-- I'm, tch, I'm speechless.  I was...I was not in the mood to listen to this thing now.  I don't know what to say.  I'm moved and I laughed and I-- Uh, I, you know, I was on the edge of my seat.  I just think it's wonderful! I'm, I'm totally...stunned.  This is not an insult.  I'm amazed that you can...  It was-- I just thought it was great.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yes!  I was abso-- And...w- what...made you think of that climax scene where the, where the... architect is walking home with his actress girlfriend and-and the ex- wife who's schizophrenic jumps out of the bushes and stabs him to death?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, it just came to me one day.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, it was just fabulous!  I'm, I, you know...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, gosh, you really think I can write?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I thought it was wonder-- There's maybe one or two things in there that I would do differently myself, but...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...but who cares?  It was just--  It was fabulous.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Fabulous, I mean it!  I'm so impressed.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, God!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I am.  You-you made my day.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, wow!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: It was just great.  Uh, I was all set...I was set to be bored stiff.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Uh, gee.  Would you like to have lunch?  Uh, uh...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I-I would love to talk to you about, uh, that script.  I-I, you know, I think maybe that we could do something with it.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Okay, and listen, I would like to hear what made you suddenly decide to drop out of life.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh, who cares?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Y-you used to-- Oh, no!  Yeah, I care.  You used to be so ambitious and...  God, you really liked it?!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Gosh, you really went through a crisis, you know that?  H-how did you get over it?  I mean, when I ran into you, you seemed, you seemed just perfectly fine.  Well, you seem fine now.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well...  I'll tell you.  One day about a month ago...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Um...look, there's something I've, uh, that's been bothering me for a long time, and I just thought I'd just tell you what it was and just sort of clear the deck here, and  that's this.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh, yeah?  What?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: That I've always regretted the way I behaved that evening we went out, and, uh...I've, I just thought I'd tell you that because I really made a fool out of myself.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh, don't be silly!  No!  Don't be ridiculous.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: It's all right.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I was the, I was... You know, it was my fault.  I--

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: So, so you want to go out to dinner again?  I mean, is that, is that... Have, you have any interest in that, or...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Sure.  Sure, uh, yes.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Do you?  I mean, are you, are you, are you, are you free this evening?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Now don't get nervous.  It's just your husband.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Hi.  How you doin'?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: When'd you get here?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Just a few minutes ago.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh.  You look so beautiful.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You know, I was talking with your father before...and I was telling him that  it's ironic.  I-I used to always have Thanksgiving with Hannah...and I never thought  that I could love anybody else.  And here it is, years later and I'm married to you  and completely in love with you.  The heart is a very, very resilient little muscle.  It really is.  I...  It'd made a great story, I think. A guy marries one sister...  doesn't work out...  many years later...  he winds up  married to the other sister.  It's, you know, it's a...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Tch.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I don't know how you're gonna top that.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Mickey?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Mmm, what?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I'm pregnant.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, my God.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I need an antihistamine.  Mom thinks she's feeling her asthma, and so...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, Mom's Camille when she gets up in the morning.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: At least she isn't drinking.  Did you notice?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Mm-hm.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yeah, she knows it, too, 'cause she's flirting with all the men here.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: God.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Get a garter belt...  Get a garter belt and flirt.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Where are the antihistamines?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Dad...

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: ...which I did not get.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Thanks.  But guess who was there auditioning?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: April?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, well, she and an architect are now a very definite item, which I still cannot believe.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Hmm.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, please!  We all came to have lunch, didn't we?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, okay, right.  Forget it.  What's to eat?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Boy...Holly...Holly.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I just want a salad.  You really think I'm a loser, don't you?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Why are you so upset?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: You know, you've been picking on her ever since she came in here. Now just leave her alone for a while!  I'm just suffocating.

turns.speaker: KRISHNA LEADER
turns.text: What makes you interested in becoming a Hare Krishna?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, I'm not saying that I want to join or anything, but...but I know you guys believe in reincarnation, you know, so it interests me.

turns.speaker: KRISHNA LEADER
turns.text: Yeah, well, what's your religion?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, I was born Jewish, you know, but, uh, but last winter I tried to become a Catholic and...it didn't work for me.  I-I studied and I tried and I gave it everything, but, you know, Catholicism for me was die now, pay later, you know. And I just couldn't get with it. And I, and I wanted to, you know. I--

turns.speaker: KRISHNA LEADER
turns.text: You're afraid of dying? MICKEY  Well...yeah, naturally.  Aren't you? I-- L-let me ask you, reincarnation, does that mean my soul would pass to another human being, or would I come back as a moose or an aardvark or something?

turns.speaker: KRISHNA LEADER
turns.text: Take our literature...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: KRISHNA LEADER
turns.text: ...read it over, and think about it.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, okay.  Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: KRISHNA LEADER
turns.text: You're welcome.  Hare Krishna.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Aren't you glad to see me?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Tell me about your trip... what did you <u>bring</u> me...?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I can't think.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...you don't have to think.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: We have to talk about <u>money</u>...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I'm on the track of a reward, which...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: A reward...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I'm going to tell you later....

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: A reward for what?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Some museum director disappeared.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: They're offering...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: ...you haven't <u>found</u> him yet.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: <u>What</u> is this, a whorehouse, or are you my <u>wife</u>?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You've gone off to America, on your <u>Vacation</u>...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...I was <u>working</u>...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: ...<u>please</u>...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I <u>swear</u> to you...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: ...and I want to talk to you about your <u>promotion</u>..

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Yes?  My <u>promotion</u>...?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I want to talk to you about your <u>salary</u>. Because I can't...

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: You know why that is?  Because there are so few things I need to forget. Would you agree, for the record, that I have not been read my rights?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I have not read you your rights.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Would you mind saying that into your bag...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I hereby acknowledge that...

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: And now I have "dociled" you, have I not?  By forcing your obedience.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Then why did you chose to <u>inform</u> me of it...?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: To <u>show</u>...  in my ability to <u>squander</u>.  What one might deem an <u>advantage</u>... that my <u>strength</u> is greater than <u>yours</u>...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Oh yeah?  Wanna arm wrestle...?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: If you'll come down the street I will make you a cup of coffee.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Well.  Word gets around.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: ...what <u>hindered</u> you...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: It wasn't my day.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Perhaps you did not have the <u>support</u> you required.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: It's a poor workman who blames his tools.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Or, perhaps...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...how are things at the Hospital?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: It's a growth business.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: What have they got you doing?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Orderly.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I would have figured you an R.N. by now, or, maybe Med School.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: I prefer to stay in the Less Frivolous professions.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: You lasted eight years, as Orderly, in Dr. Lechter's prison ward.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Yes, I presumed it was about him.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: I'm struck by your phraseology.  I did not <u>last</u> with him.  I was privileged to enjoy his company during that time.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I'm looking for...

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: He said, and these were his words, he <u>valued</u> our time together, because I was civil.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Did you ever think, did you think, after he escaped, he would come after you?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: He told me, he preferred to Eat the Rude. Or:  "natural composting."  Do you think he'd come after <u>you</u>...?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: I asked you how you like your coffee...? We have black and bitter.  As the Soul of Man.  Or light and sweet, as the world- view of the self-delusive.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: We got a bunch of <u>materials</u>, coming up at auction.  Materials which disappeared from Dr. Lechter's cell, drawings he made, his <u>books</u>.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: And I'd like your help, determining who's bidding for their purchase.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Why me?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Waal, because your <u>selling</u>'em... Two years ago, his annotated Dictionary of Cuisine, by Alexander Dumas, went for sixteen thousand dollars. Seller's affidavit of ownership, signed Cary Panz.  P.A.N.Z.  Sounds to me like an Orderly.  Whadja clear on the book? Ten, twelve grand?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: ...very good.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Here's what they want you to do:  we want the rest of the stuff you stole from his cell.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: ...why?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Let's just say they got a passion for collectibles...

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: You said "here's what <u>they</u> want you to do..."  Why?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Now, whyn't you help us?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: That would adversely impact my income.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Not as much as being jailed for theft of Government Property, or for failure to pay income tax, on undisclosed income.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: We could skip the Gavotte.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Say it in English.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Lechter's not buying up his Memorabilia. He keeps it all in his "mind," do you see...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Then who's buying it?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: There's one or two freaks, and, for a "<u>Pass</u>," I'll rat them out to you...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: <u>That's</u> the spirit...

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: ...aren't you afraid of me...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: You want me to be?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: I'd prefer it...  But it's just a vacant exercise.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: You said "here's what <u>they</u> want you to do."  Aren't you part of them anymore...?  Aren't you part of the FBI? 'No Girl's Allowed,' or <u>what</u>?  Have you transgressed...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Let's keep it to business, shall we?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: ...why have they stuck you on this silly little roust?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...they did it for a lark.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Oh, Good.  The ornithological leitmotif...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: <u>Who</u> are these guys...?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Rich, comic book freaks.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: And why is it a vacant exercise?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Because we both know who's buying the Lechteriana.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Who would that be.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Mason Verger.  For he cannot be free. Dr. Lechter refashioned his body so it mirrors his soul, what an impossible injustice.  Can <u>you</u> be free....?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: No, you're wrong about Verger.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Oh, yes.  He's found Peace.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Well, if he hasn't, I'm vastly mistaken.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: And have <u>you</u> found Peace..?

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: Bad beat today.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Hey, I'm fine.  Whaddizit, you, how's your day, our gallant International Neighbors...?

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: Evelda Drumgo.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: COULD I GET A <u>DRINK</u>,  N'I don't <u>care</u>, you see, what all they got me doin, for I'd rather be doin' <u>makework</u>, than be doin' <u>pub'l'relations</u> with THE DIRTY DOZEN, one <u>Hispanic</u>, one <u>Librarian</u>, one <u>Jew</u>, and One from Column A, and One from Column...  Thank you.

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: C'mon, pal.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: All y'got to do is <u>ask</u>...

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: You want to get married...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: You tol me you wuunt ask me again til I'm ready....

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: You're ready now.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I'm not.

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: That's what <u>you</u> think...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Then you tell me, then.

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: You want me to solve all your problems tonight...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I feel...  I feel they're Out to <u>Get</u> Me...

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: And who is "they?"

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...they're sending me.  Out to get Shot.  Hounding me.... they're...

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: ...the whole world's out to get you...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: How crazy is that.

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: Well, you wanna shoot <u>back</u>, it give you a big <u>target</u>...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: How <u>crazy</u> is that....

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Hard up as you are, at your age?  Whadda <u>you</u> care?  Surrender.

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: ~Don't shoot, G-Men..."

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: How you doin?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: M'I gonna see you tonight?

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Then I'm doing fine.

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: What's new onna street?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: All Quiet Along the Potomac...

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: Brigham.  Go.  Affirmative.  Okay, Happiness is a Green Light.  We've got Evelda in the kitchen, cooking.  The dope's D.E.A.  <u>We</u> want her on Interstate Transportation of some firecrackers.  Starling:  you've got Drumgo, you know her from before.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I know her by the Back.

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: ...these guy'll back you up.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: What, What, I can't hear you...

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: Are you <u>alright</u>...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I almost shot the <u>baby</u>...

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: Who called the <u>TV CREWS</u>...?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Who, can you think, who would want to harm Dr. Fanelli, did he have any <u>enemies</u>, that...

turns.speaker: COMMITTEE MEMBER
turns.text: ...I have never met a man who was so well beloved.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...he was <u>wealthy</u>...

turns.speaker: COMMITTEE MEMBER
turns.text: He had nothing.  He lived in a garret. His work was his life, he...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...his family has offered a large reward.

turns.speaker: COMMITTEE MEMBER
turns.text: ..who would benefit from his disappearance?  <u>No</u> one.  No one has but lost by it...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...would you excuse me...?

turns.speaker: COP ONE
turns.text: How was America?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Bad coffee, and women with excessive ankles.

turns.speaker: COP ONE
turns.text: ...nightmare.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: What's up...?

turns.speaker: COP ONE
turns.text: Doctore Carlo Fanelli, curator of the Pallazo Capponi, 2 months missing.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Yeah, so where is he?

turns.speaker: COP ONE
turns.text: Somewhere where his family are offering a thirty grand reward for Information, so on.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: They got that kind of money?

turns.speaker: COP ONE
turns.text: Their family owns...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: What else did I miss...?

turns.speaker: COP ONE
turns.text: Atrocious Torture.  Hit of the Season, you want, I know a guy can get you a ticket.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...are they hard to get?

turns.speaker: COP ONE
turns.text: Impossible.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...what a world.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Hold up a minute...

turns.speaker: COP ONE
turns.text: You spend the afternoon in Bed?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: First things first.

turns.speaker: COP ONE
turns.text: You take this much time over everything?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: That's why my wife adores me.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: The identity of the person offering the bounty was never established.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Yes, but we know who it was, and I will tell you, Agent Starling, what you know to be true.  I offered the bounty.  It was illegal, and, worse, it was <u>wrong</u>. And I thank God every day that I did not compound my sinful life by the stain of a murder.  Do you  Agent Starling:  do you know <u>God</u>?

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Can we identify it as Dr. Lechter?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Not with any certainty we...

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Why did he come back?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Our operatives in Brazil have been empowered to offer a reward of....

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: ...WHY DID HE COME BACK?  WHY DID THE BOY TURN BACK...?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ...are you alright, sir...?

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: HE TURNED BACK INTO THE ROOM.  Where have we Seen it Before.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Seen what, sir..?

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: The puppy comes back.  If you lie on the ground.  The Puppy with return.  Why? Do you know why...?  TO KILL YOU.  IT THINKS YOU HAVE FALLEN AND ARE POWERLESS. IT COMES BACK TO TEAR YOUR THROAT. THAT'S WHY THE CHILD TURNED BACK.  As Lechter will return back.  You see?  To the sight of his oppressor <u>wounded</u>. He will return to savage our beloved Miss Starling.  Bring me a drink.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: <u>Do</u> it...

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ...Let's see the pigs, please.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Where was the call from.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Somewhere in Italy.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Make plans for Lechter's abduction.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ...then we won't need to tether Miss Starling as our lure.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: That operation has begun.  Are we God, that we would <u>Meddle</u> with it...?  <u>No</u>, on the <u>other</u> hand...

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Waal, Nobody's <u>Perfect</u>... What do we hear from our songbird in Switzerland?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: If you would see him monument, look around you.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Show me the Pigs.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: He escaped...

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Have the child taken to bed.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Follow Starling, stake out Starling. Increase the pressure on Starling.  He will come to her.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ...thank you...  And how are you this evening, Doctor? No, we know that you're awake...

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Good evening, Dr. Lechter.  Thank you for coming.  I am sorry that we could not meet under more pleasant circumstances.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ..It won't be long now, sir...

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: OHFORGODSAKE, get ON with it.

turns.speaker: FRANKLIN
turns.text: He don't like popcorn.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: No.  And...

turns.speaker: FRANKLIN
turns.text: I like Popcorn...

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ...yes, if you'll, just step <u>away</u>...

turns.speaker: FRANKLIN
turns.text: You give me whatever I want...?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Yes.  You know I will.  That's right.

turns.speaker: FRANKLIN
turns.text: Awright.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Agent Starling, would you come with me...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: The children...?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ...they're from Baltimore....

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I've never heard that he...

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: It's not something he wants to publicize, Ma'am.  It's just something he does.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I won't take much of his time.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: He's glad to help.  ...it's just a question of his physical condition.  You Understand...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: What would <u>that</u> be?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: He... would consider it a favor if he could make a <u>donation</u>.  To a charitable institution of your choice.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Now, why in the world would he do that?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: I... think... he was.... he was <u>touched</u>, by your reaction.  To his appearance.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: What reaction?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Please, I do not... I don't want to <u>trouble</u> him.  But if you or he have any notlon, who would be buying Dr. Lechter's...

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Do you know the <u>seller</u>?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: We've subpoenaed the Auction House's records.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Try Barney Clark.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: He is...?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: He was the orderly, during Dr. Lechter's stay in Prison.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: And how would you know that?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Before "The Change," Mr. Verger was... he made quite a study.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: You should get the kids a <u>dog</u>...

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ....I hardly <u>think</u> so... after "The Incident"...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: No, no, of course not.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ...Mr. Verger would be pleased to make a contribution, to the charitable...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Tell him to give it to an orphanage.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: No, I think he proffers to spend his happy hours with his playmates.

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: ...young boys, still...?

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ...here's to child abuse!

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: Mmm...

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ...and then, he'll be coming down.

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: You said the <u>bad</u> news...

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Yes, I did.

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: I believe that your tone implied that there was some <u>good</u> news.... and, do you know... there might be good news for <u>you</u>...

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Oh, yes, what?  You'd <u>bribe</u> me, to, to, to, "release" you...?

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: I can make you rich.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: And I expect you to.  Let's talk like two medical men

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Come on, stay with us.  Look here:  I could get behind you, and give you a <u>spinal</u>, tomorrow, you wuunt feel <u>anything</u> down there, a l'il <u>pulling</u> is all.  N'I'll tell you <u>what</u>, after he's got his jollies, ten, f'teen minutes, I'll come down here, give you a shotta <u>this</u>  stop your heart, an that's <u>you</u> done, an there's an <u>end</u> to it.  What do you say...?  I know you got lotsa money, evabody says so.  I know how that stuff works, take it out, move it <u>around</u>...  ...stay with me now, <u>fuss</u> with it... Whatsay we call your banker now, tell him a <u>code</u>... move that money to me, he <u>confirms</u> it, and I fix you up Right Now...  Whatsay?

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: ..suitcase...locker...

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Come on, Doctor, <u>then</u> you can sleep...

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: ...unmarked hundreds....

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: ...fraid, that's about it, Doctor.

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: Let the girl go.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: For a consideration.

turns.speaker: CORDELL
turns.text: 'fraid it's too late.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Sir:

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Shut up, Starling...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I could have acted on my own.  I was told...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Starling, I've ordered you to shut...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ..I was <u>instructed</u> that this was a Joint Task Force, the FBI, BATF, and the Mayor's Special...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I don't mind being the token <u>woman</u>, what I'm suggesting, send me out there with a token <u>man</u>... who are these Warriors, ¥our cobbled together Strike Force?  I'm in the room with a fugitive felon...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Starling...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: One moment, and they're at the <u>Seven-</u> <u>Eleven</u>.  They botched the fallback plan, they...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Why would you say that?  Because he sent me in there to be killed...?  What <u>is</u> this...?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: ...what's he got against you?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: He once made me an improper suggestion.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Look at this:

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: You seen John Brigham...?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: This just came in, over the transom. Fella, works for a Plastic Surgeon, Argentina.  Look here:

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...what'm I looking at...?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: A fellow with five fingers.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...standard issue...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Not for our Doctor Lechter.  This...  Purports to be an x-ray of the hand of a ...white male...mmmm....mmmm...., after the removal of a vestigial sixth digit. Left Hand.  It purports to be the x-ray of Dr. L...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Am I on that case, sir...?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Well, then--I wouldn't want to be taken for a <u>hobbyist</u>...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Yes sir, I saw it.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: We have a memo here, from your friend Mr. Krendler at the Justice Department.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I am all attention.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: He requests your presence, once again, as part of...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I know you did what you could.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I'm going to work for your reinstatement...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Reinstatement to <u>what</u>?  There ain't nobody there...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Just a moment.  Starling didn't...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Well, well, well, well, well, she went <u>in</u> there, to apprehend a Dangerous Felon. Went in there with her gun, Came out, <u>without</u> the Felon, with<u>out</u> the gun...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I had... one moment, I had an <u>agent</u> in there, waiting for <u>backup</u> from...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: ...she couldn't act on her own..?  Where is the FBI's vaunted Initiative, where..?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I think that's... {HE STARTS TO RISE, AND THE MEETING BEGINS TO BREAK UP) Starling, I'm sure these gentlemen...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: And how did she get close enough to disarm you?

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: She threw a punch at a man on the team.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Well, you know, that happens, on the street.

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: What is that supposed to mean...?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I think its meaning is clear.

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: What, you're saying she was overwrought.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: That could be.

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Because that's understandable, because. She blew the raid.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: She was there, alone, sir, she was in a burning building, waiting for your folks to come through the wall.  And...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: One moment, I'm not done with you...  Give him the file...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Your girl's a menace.  Here, givver <u>this</u>... Getter off the street and teach her some <u>humility</u>.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: I don't <u>think</u> so...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Well, then, you have insufficient information.  I'm grateful for this opportunity to set you straight.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: S'hotter inside than it is <u>outside</u>...even with the air conditioning.

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: You nervous...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Evone tells me:  I shoulda been in, fi, six, months ago.... thizz my first checkup.

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: Gonna be fine.  You ask your momma.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ....I didn't realize I said it out loud.

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: Said what?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I'm an orphan.

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: Well, then, you're a lucky girl, cause that baby's gone to be your family.  ...I've got an appointment....

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: Waal...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: It gets, um... it gets so lonely sometime.

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: What'd you say, hon...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I said sometime it gets so...

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: Well, don't you worry, cause that <u>baby's</u> gone take care of <u>that</u>.

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: Waited too long, hon...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: How's your <u>child</u>?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I said how's your baby...?

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: You want to <u>hold</u> him...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Waal...

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: 'bout time you <u>learned</u>...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Give it up, Evelda.

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: Well, you know my name, honey, but I don't know yours...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Give it up.

turns.speaker: DRUMGO
turns.text: Hey, you know, I never thought of that...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Sadly, no.  And I find that birth is one of the few things in life which study and a pleasant attitude can not amend. What do you think?

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: And how do we account for the interest of such a charming man, an interest in Torture?

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: My husband brought it to me from America.

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: A wonderful country...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: You know it?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: I have had many excellent meals there.

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: And yet, they are not know for their cuisine.

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: ...should love to correct your error.

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: Well, perhaps sometime we...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: My mother told me to ignore the blandishments of charming men.

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Then, she, <u>herself</u>, possessed some knowledge of the Greater World...How pleased am I to see you looking so well...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: How wonderful of you, to hold that information in your <u>busy</u> mind...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: ...how so?

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: ...you told me you were studying for your examination by the <u>Studiolo</u>...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: And how good of <u>you</u> to remember it. Then, this trip, then, is not a return to <u>America</u>...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: No, this is <u>pleasure</u>...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: And what was the trip <u>before</u>...?

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: That, that was <u>business</u>...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Of course, Commendatore...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Could you tell me:  did you ever meet your predecessor, Dottore Fanelli...?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: I never met him.  I knew him only from his writings.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I know that the officers who first investigated his disappearance searched for a <u>note</u>, a farewell note, a suicide note...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: ...yes.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: You have taken over his offices, is that not so?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: It is only temporary, until my confirmation by...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Of course, <u>in</u> his offices, if you come across anything, any personal papers of his, anything, however trivial, would you contact me, please... Are his personal effects still at the Palazzo?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Yes.  Packed and with an inventory.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I'll have them picked up.

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: If your duty requires it.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: You have a recent scar on the back of your hand.

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: And you have a new wedding ring on yours? <u>La Vita Nuova</u>?--

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: You looked oddly at me, back on the landing.

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Yes, it must be hard to be a policeman. Is it hard?  Must one, then, be constantly suspicious?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Why did you look at me that way?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: I saw a man in disheveled clothing, but <u>clean</u>.  Just dressed--in the middle of the...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: I saw a man, somewhat <u>fatigued</u>. Quickly dressed, a bit dishevelled.  In the middle of the day.  An old story.  And then I saw the clothing was <u>fresh</u>--therefore:  a man who dressed at <u>home</u>.  And then I remarked the new <u>wedding</u> ring.  And so:  the <u>story</u> gave me pause.  A lovely story.  A new, and a beloved <u>wife</u>.  I wish you joy.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: You assemble this, on the instant, from these few observations?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: I'm a historian.  It is our task to assemble the seemingly unconnected into the obvious.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...your <u>scar</u>..?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: My scar is a war-wound.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: How so?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Carpal-tunnel syndrome.  From a life of typing.  Commendatore.  <u>History</u>, a hazardous profession.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Yes.  How did you know?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: You resemble a figure from the Della Robia Rondels, in your family's chapel at Santa Croce.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: It was Adresa de Pazzi, depicted as John the Baptist.  You have seen the chapel?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: I have had the honor.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: And?  Then?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: I wonder no longer.  You were out of the country.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: How could you know?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: I <u>sense</u>...  The faintest <u>whiff</u> of a perfume, whose <u>base</u>, whose <u>base</u>, whose <u>base</u> is "Hamamelis" ... it is <u>witch-hazel</u>--such a clean scent.  No, not a European scent. I would say it is a scent of the New World.  I would say, you have been in America.  Have I struck home?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: You know America?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: ...you have <u>brought</u> this perfume... brought this perfume.  Back.  <u>Back</u> from America.  To your New Wife...  You have given it to her, and some of...  Some of 'her perfume' has found its way back onto you.  Lucky man.  Lucky man, indeed.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Darling, Dr. Fell.  My wife Madame Pazzi.

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Enchante.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Dr. Fell is studying for his examination by the Studiolo.

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Indeed I am.  And the connection, between Dante, and, in fact, between your illustrious forebears... if you'd come with me, I could show you...
